metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Operators are used to perform operations on values and variables.
content.html: Operators are used to perform operations on values and variables.

content.text: Rust supports many common operators, like:
Arithmetic operators are used to do basic math:
content.html: Arithmetic operators are used to do basic math:

content.code_html:
OperatorNameExampleResult
+Addition5 + 38
-Subtraction5 - 32
*Multiplication5 * 315
/Division10 / 25
%Remainder (modulus)10 % 31

fn main() {
  let add = 5 + 3;
  let sub = 10 - 4;
  let mul = 6 * 2;
  let div = 12 / 3;
  let rem = 10 % 3;

  println!("Add: {}", add);
  println!("Sub: {}", sub);
  println!("Mul: {}", mul);
  println!("Div: {}", div);
  println!("Rem: {}", rem);
}

content.text: Assignment operators are used to assign and update values:
content.html: Assignment operators are used to assign and update values:

content.code_html:
OperatorExampleSame As
=x = 5Assign 5 to x
+=x += 3x = x + 3
-=x -= 2x = x - 2
*=x *= 4x = x * 4
/=x /= 2x = x / 2
%=x %= 2x = x % 2

fn main() {
  let mut x = 10;
  println!("Start: {}", x);

  x += 5;
  println!("After += 5: {}", x);

  x -= 2;
  println!("After -= 2: {}", x);

  x *= 2;
  println!("After *= 2: {}", x);

  x /= 3;
  println!("After /= 3: {}", x);

  x %= 4;
  println!("After %= 4: {}", x);
}

content.text: Comparison operators compare values and return true or false :
content.html: Comparison operators compare values and return true or false:

content.code_html:
OperatorMeaningExample
==Equal to5 == 5 is true
!=Not equal to5 != 3 is true
>Greater than7 > 3 is true
<Less than2 < 5 is true
>=Greater than or equal to5 >= 5 is true
<=Less than or equal to3 <= 4 is true

fn main() {
  let a = 5;
  let b = 10;

  println!("5 == 10: {}", a == b);
  println!("5 != 10: {}", a != b);
  println!("5 < 10: {}", a < b);
  println!("5 >= 10: {}", a >= b);
}

content.text: Logical operators are used to work with boolean values:
content.html: Logical operators are used to work with boolean values:

content.code_html:
OperatorNameDescription
&&ANDtrue if both values are true
||ORtrue if at least one is true
!NOTinverts the boolean value

fn main() {
  let logged_in = true;
  let is_admin = false;

  println!("Is regular user: {}", logged_in && !is_admin);
  println!("Has any access: {}", logged_in || is_admin);
  println!("Not logged in: {}", !logged_in);
}
